appDescription.message: Quick, keyword based autocomplete for your search engines

searchShortInformation.message: Type in your search engine keyword and then your search terms.

optionsKeyword.description: Keyword used to open this add-on options (settings). Note! Keep in sync. with the `popup.html` text.

optionsKeywordShortInformation.message: Open search autocomplete options (settings) in current tab.
optionsKeywordShortInformation.description: Short description shown in the address bar for the keyword.

options.confirmPermanentStorage.message: Are you sure you want to save all changes? This is a permanent change.

options.confirmReloadFromStorage.message: Are you sure you want to undo all changes and reload from storage? Note! All your changes will be lost.

options.confirmImport.message:
Are you sure you want to import this data? All your changes will be lost.

Note! You will still need to store changes to make them permanent.

options.Note_All_changes_are_temporary_u.message: Note! All changes are temporary until you store them.

options.Action.open.information.message: This information will be used if the server will not return a specific URL to open. Use `{searchTerms}` text in a value (it will be replace with entered search terms).

options.Action.autocomplete.information.message: This service is used for the auto-complete (generating search suggestions). This service must at least return titles, but should also return descriptions, and URLs to open. The format should conform with the OpenSearch Suggestions standard.

options.ImportInformation.message: Loose validation is provided when importing. You might still need to e.g. change keywords to make sure you don't have duplicates.

options.Import_contains_credentials.message: Note! There are credentials in your import. Make sure this is as inteaded. Check the autocomplete URL.

options.Import_failure.message: Import failed. Make sure syntax is correct.

options.Credentials_information.message: Credentials can be used when a search service requires using login and password (so called HTTP basic authentication). Note your data is stored locally and the credentials are separated from the search engines. When you export your search engines only the codename will be in the export.
